36.0: If one buries his dead three days before a festival, the
36.1: restrictions appertaining to his seven days' mourning fall away; [if he  buries his dead] eight days before a festival, the restrictions of the  thirty [days] fall away, 10 because they [the sages] said that the Sabbath enters into count but foes not interrupt, while festivals interrupt and do not enter into count.

52.1: The Rabbis taught: From when do we turn over the beds? Our Rabbis taught: Formerly, they were wont to serve drinks in a house of mourning, the rich in white glass vessels and the poor in coloured glass, and the poor felt shamed: they instituted therefore that all should serve drinks in coloured glass, out of deference to the poor. Formerly they were
52.2: wont to uncover the face of the rich and cover the face of the poor, because their faces turned livid in years of drought and the poor felt shamed; they therefore instituted that everybody's face should be covered, out of deference for the poor.38 Formerly. they were wont to bring out the rich [for burial] on a dargesh39 aid the poor
